newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post page one - Jan 7.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post page one - Jan 7.

text.p: The Washington Post carried the following stories on its front page on January 7:

WASHINGTON - A determinedly upbeat Representative Newt Gingrich went before his Republican colleagues to rally support for his reelection as House speaker after a respected committee chairman said he would not vote for him.
WASHINGTON - The heart of the ethics committee case against House Speaker Newt Gingrich involves his use of charitable organizations to subsidise his partisan political activities.

WASHINGTON - A deeply divided Social Security advisory council put forth several drastic and controversial changes to the retirement system as a means of saving it from severe financial shortfalls in the next centrury.

WASHINGTON - When Kofi Annan replaced Boutros Boutros-Ghali as secretary general of the United Nations last week, it was a personal triumph for Madeleine Albright, U.S. ambassador to the world body and President Clinton's nominee for secretary of state.

WASHINGTON - Thousands of people will be on the job on January 20 for President Clinton's second inauguration. Some will be working for the reward of participating in an historic event, while others will receive a paycheck bonanza as the inauguration falls on the Martin Luther King day holiday.
LINCOLN, R.I. - A Rhode Island man suffering from Lou Gehrig's disease has publicly proclaimed that he will commit suicide and is defending the right to die with his last breath.
